ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's a great introductory course, and the work is totally manageable. Great for the language requirement or if you just want to learn a language! Also, Professor Alexandrov is wonderful.

It is unfortunate that you have to take 3 semesters of Spanish, being in the awkward situation of having known some spanish, but still having to take the same number of semesters as someone who is starting a new language. Despite this fact, it is a very doable class if one stays a top of their work and puts the necessary amount of effort into the class. I would recommend this class to those who are placed in it.
The course is fast paced and covers a lot of material, though you will actually learn Spanish in the process. I would strongly recommend it, specifically with Professor Alexandrov.

Most of you will need it for the requirement, but if at all possible, take it with Sybil Alexandrov. She is a fantastic professor, fair grader, and has a great sense of humor. You won't regret it; at the very least, shop her section, if you can.

Spanish 120 is a great class. There are a lot of grammar exercises and the class is taught entirely in spanish,but It is surprisingly fun. The teachers do a pretty good job of making the syllabus diverse enough to keep the class entertaining past the repetition of grammar. I also have noticed that my spanish has markedly improved since the beginning of the term. The course is 1.5 credits and meets five times a week, so sometimes it feels like you are always doing spanish, but I did not feel like it was too overwhelming. Overall though, if you are looking to take a language course, I think this was a great one to take.
If you want/need to learn Spanish, and you either placed in here or just took l1, take this class.
